extends CcddFrameHandler

    • Constructor Detail

      • CcddEventLogDialog

        CcddEventLogDialog(CcddMain ccddMain,
                   CcddClassesComponent.FileEnvVar logFile,
                   java.lang.Long targetRow,
                   boolean isSessionLog)
        Event log class constructor
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class
        logFile - event log file; null if creating the session log or if opening a user-selected log file
        targetRow - row index a specific log entry in an existing log to display in a stand-alone table without message length constraints; null if not displaying a single log entry
        isSessionLog - true if this is the event log for the current session

      • CcddEventLogDialog

        CcddEventLogDialog(CcddMain ccddMain,
                   boolean isSessionLog)
        Event log class constructor
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class
        isSessionLog - true if this is the event log for the current session

        Show or hide the web server message filter check box. The server check box is shown only when the web server exists (even if the server is subsequently disabled)
        Parameters:
        show - true to show the check box; false to hide it

                         boolean isFiltered)
        Set the specified filter check box state
        Parameters:
        type - Event log message type (e.g., COMMAND_MSG)
        isFiltered - true to set enable display of the specified message type; false to hide messages of the specified type

      • openEventLogFile

        private boolean openEventLogFile()
        Open the event log file. If this is the current session's event log then create the file; if this is an existing log then open the user-selected file
        Returns:
        true if the log is opened

        Parameters:

        logMessage - new event's log message
        dialogMessage - error dialog message

        dialogTitle - error dialog title
        logMessage - new event's log message
        dialogMessage - error dialog message

      • addMessageToLog

        private void addMessageToLog(java.lang.String server,
                             java.lang.String database,
                             java.lang.String user,
                             CcddConstants.EventLogMessageType type,
                             java.lang.String timestamp,
                             java.lang.String logMessage)
        Add a new log entry to the event log table
        Parameters:
        server - server host and port
        database - database connection
        user - user name
        type - message type (e.g., COMMAND_MSG)
        timestamp - date and time when event occurred
        logMessage - new event's log message

      • getDateTimeStamp

        private java.lang.String getDateTimeStamp(java.lang.String format)
        Get the current system date and time stamp
        Parameters:
        format - date and time stamp format
        Returns:
        Date and time string in the format specified

      • getDateTimeStampLog

        private java.lang.String getDateTimeStampLog(java.lang.String timestamp)
        Format the date and time string provided for display in the event log table
        Parameters:
        timestamp - date and time string in the format [month/day/year][ ] [hours/minutes/seconds]
        Returns:
        The date and time string formatted for HTML, centered, and with the month/day/year and hours/minutes/seconds on separate lines

      • getServerLog

        private java.lang.String getServerLog(java.lang.String server)
        Format the server string provided for display in the event log table
        Parameters:
        server - server string in the format [server name][:][port number]
        Returns:
        The server string formatted for HTML, centered, and with the server name and port number on separate lines

        Output the event log to a printer

      • truncateLogMessage

        private java.lang.String truncateLogMessage(java.lang.String logMessage)
        Truncate the log message if its length exceeds the maximum allowed
        Parameters:
        logMessage - log message
        Returns:
        Log message, truncated to the maximum length, and with an ellipsis and number of truncated characters appended, if its length exceeds the maximum allowed
